verses.text: 凡負軛作奴僕的，應當看自己的主人是配受十分的敬重，免得　神的名和道理被人褻瀆。

words.note: Refers to servitude, often used metaphorically for burdens.
Can refer to a human master or the Lord (God).
Lit. 'ten parts', meaning completely or to a great extent.
The leading space is a traditional way to show reverence for God.
In a biblical context, often refers to God's truth or doctrine.

verses.text: 奴僕有信主的主人，不可因為他們是弟兄而輕看他們；倒要加意服事他們，因為這些受到服事的益處的，是信主蒙愛的人。你要把這些事教導人，勸勉人。

words.note: Can refer to biological brothers or fellow believers.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun.

verses.text: 敬虔與知足如果有人傳別的教義，不接受我們的主耶穌基督純正的話語，和那敬虔的道理，

words.note: Refers to Jesus as Lord.

verses.text: 他是自高自大，一無所知，反而專好問難爭辯，由此產生妒忌、紛爭、毀謗、惡意的猜疑，

words.note: An idiom describing someone who thinks highly of themselves.
An idiom meaning utterly uninformed.

verses.text: 就和那些心術敗壞，喪失真理的人不斷地爭吵。他們視敬虔為得利的門路。

words.note: Used to introduce the result of a 'regard as' construction.

verses.text: 其實敬虔而又知足，就是得大利的途徑，

words.note: Refers to reverence and devotion to God.
Lit. 'to know sufficiency'.

verses.text: 因為我們沒有帶甚麼到世上來，也不能帶甚麼去。
只要有衣有食，就應當知足。

words.note: Lit. 'to know sufficiency'.

verses.text: 但那些想要發財的人，就落在試探中和陷阱裡；又落在許多無知而有害的私慾裡，使人沉淪在敗壞和滅亡中；

words.definition: to want, to be going to
to get rich, make a fortune

words.note: Refers to a moral or spiritual test, often leading to sin.
Refers to covetous or uncontrolled desires.
Implies spiritual ruin or moral degradation.
Refers to moral or spiritual decay and destruction.
Often refers to eternal destruction.

verses.text: 因為貪財是萬惡之根。有人貪愛錢財，就被引誘離開真道，用許多痛苦把自己刺透了。

words.note: A specific biblical concept referring to greed for wealth.
Classical Chinese equivalent of 'de' (的).
Highlights a grasping, excessive form of love/desire.
Often refers to God's truth or Christian doctrine.
Often used metaphorically for deep, penetrating pain or sorrow.

verses.text: 要為信仰打那美好的仗但你這屬　神的人啊，應該逃避這些事，要追求公義、敬虔、信心、愛心、忍耐和溫柔。

words.note: Refers to religious faith or conviction.
The space before '神' is a stylistic reverence in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 要為信仰打那美好的仗，持定永生；你是為這永生而蒙召的，又在許多的證人面前承認過美好的信仰。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for 'holding fast' to a truth or promise.
Biblical term for receiving a divine calling.

verses.text: 我在賜生命給萬物的　神面前，並那在本丟．彼拉多面前見證過美好的信仰的基督耶穌面前囑咐你，
你當毫無玷污，無可指摘地持守這命令，直到我們主耶穌基督的顯現。

words.note: An idiom meaning 'nothing to criticize'.
Capitalized when referring to God or Jesus.
Refers to the second coming of Christ.

verses.text: 到了適當的時候，那可稱頌的、獨一的全能者，萬王之王，萬主之主，必把基督的顯現表明出來。

words.note: Describes God as the one worthy of praise.
A title for God, the all-powerful one.
A title for God/Christ, emphasizing supreme authority.
A title for God/Christ, emphasizing supreme authority.
Often functions as a verb complement indicating emergence or result.

verses.text: 只有他永遠不死，住在不能接近的光裡，沒有人見過他，人也不能看見他。願尊榮和永遠的權能都歸給他。阿們。

words.note: Refers to divine omnipotence or supreme power.
A Hebrew word meaning 'so be it' or 'truly'.

verses.text: 你要囑咐那些今世富有的人，叫他們不要心高氣傲，也不要寄望在浮動的財富上，卻要仰望那厚賜百物給我們享用的　神。

words.note: A four-character idiom describing an arrogant disposition.

words.definition: to place hope in, rely on
to look up to, hope in
words.note: Often used for looking up to God with faith.
Capitalized 'S' to denote the one God.

verses.text: 又要囑咐他們行善，在善事上富足，慷慨好施。

words.note: Refers to being eager to share or give alms.

verses.text: 這樣，就為自己在來世積聚財富，作美好的基礎，好叫他們能夠得著那真正的生命。

words.note: Implies a complete or effective acquisition.
In biblical context, often refers to eternal life.

verses.text: 提摩太啊，你要保守所交託你的，避免世俗的空談和冒稱是知識的那種反調；

words.note: Introduces a passive or nominalized phrase.
Refers to a contradictory or opposing argument/stance.

verses.text: 有些人自稱有這知識，就偏離了真道。願恩惠與你們同在。

words.note: Often refers to God's truth or doctrine in a religious context.
A key theological concept signifying undeserved divine favor.
Commonly used in blessings, implying presence and fellowship.
